sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"真的，真实的，实在的"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: genuine, authentic, actual, real, true, factual
means: genuine ： 普通常用词，指真正的，货真价实的，强调非人为或非虚假的。
authentic常可与genuine换用，指与事实完全相符，强调准确可靠。
actual ： 指事物的实际存在，并非出自主观臆造。
real ： 普通用词，含义较广，有时可与actual和genuine换用。指一切真实的或 表面看不出虚假的事物。
true ： 指同实际情况或标准完全一致。口语中多用。
factual与actual同义，但更测重根据事实，不扩大或缩小，不渲染。

word_mean: real-time display 天气雷达天线扫描时回波荧光屏上当时的显示。
real-time analysis 在设备运行过程中，对实时测量信号处理的时间能够满足动态过程参数分辨需要的分析。
real-time control system 能对输入作出快速响应、快速检测和快速处理，并能及时提供输出操作信号的计算机控制系统。

sentence.Network_en: Michael Fish is my favourite. He's a hoot, a real character.
sentence.Network_cn: 我最喜欢迈克尔·菲什。他滑稽逗趣，是个实实在在的人物。

sentence.Network_en: What we need is not manifestos of pious intentions, but real action.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们需要的不是善意但难以实现的宣言，而是实际行动。

sentence.Network_en: A child may not differentiate between his imagination and the real world.
sentence.Network_cn: 儿童可能无法将自己的幻想与真实世界区分开来。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to assert that something is genuine or is actually the case
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)真正的，确实的；认真的

lj.lj_ly: I'm not playing games—this is for real!.
lj.lj_ls: 我并非在闹着玩——我是认真的！。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal, chiefly N. Amer.)used to convey that an idea or statement is foolish or overly idealistic
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式，主北美)愚蠢！荒唐！可笑！（用来表示某个想法或说法的愚蠢性或过于理想化）

lj.lj_ly: You want teens to have committed sexual relationships? Get real!.
lj.lj_ls: 你希望青少年之间有性关系？荒唐！。

jx.jx_en_mean: (humorous)used to emphasize the existence of something, especially if it is surprising or unusual
jx.jx_cn_mean: (幽默)千真万确（尤用来强调惊人、不寻常的事情的真实性）

lj.lj_ly: a real live detective had been at the factory.
lj.lj_ls: 千真万确，一个侦探曾经在厂里呆过。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)money in a large or significant amount
(informal)a thing that is absolutely genuine or authentic

lj.lj_ly: you've never been in love before, so how can you be sure this is the real thing?.
lj.lj_ls: 你以前从来没谈过恋爱，所以你怎么肯定这是真的？。

jx.jx_en_mean: Truly so in fact or actuality
jx.jx_cn_mean: 真正地，确实地：事实或现实确实如此地

lj.lj_ly: “Is this place for real? A wolf in a . . . leisure suit and a cow in a print dress wait patiently on the couch in the lobby”(&b{Teresa Carson})
lj.lj_ls: “这样的地方确实存在吗?一只穿着便装的狼和一头穿着印花服的奶牛耐心地坐在客厅的沙发上等待着”(&b{特雷萨·卡森})

means.word_mean: 真的,真正的;现实的
其他释义
真的;真实的;现实的
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as a legal term meaning 'relating to things, especially real property'): from Anglo-Norman French, from late Latin realis, from Latin res 'thing'
Spanish, literally royal' (adjective used as a noun)

encyclopedia.content: 专辑专辑简介 专辑中文名: REAL歌手: 彩虹乐队(L'Arc～en～Ciel) 音乐风格: 流行 版本: 专辑 发行时间: 2000年09月06日 语言: 日语 『REAL』是彩虹乐队的第8张专辑，收录了『LOVE FLIES』、『NEO UNIVERSE』、『finale』、『STAY AWAY』四首当时大热的歌曲。这张专辑中能听出当时的hyde的声音的转变，不仅仅是着重于高音反而开始以低音为中心发声，经常使用「浊声」让声音变形。 个人很喜欢『NEO UNIVERSE』，歌曲曲风比较明朗，

entry.def: Something that is real actually exists and is not imagined, invented, or theoretical.

example.ex: No, it wasn't a dream. It was real...
example.tran: 不，它不是一个梦，它是真实的。

example.ex: Legends grew up around a great many figures, both real and fictitious.
example.tran: 围绕着许多人物都有传说流传开，有真实的也有虚构的。

entry.tran: 身临其境的;亲身经历的
entry.def: If something is real to someone, they experience it as though it really exists or happens, even though it does not.

example.ex: Whitechild's life becomes increasingly real to the reader.
example.tran: 怀特蔡尔德的生活在读者面前显得越来越真实。

entry.tran: 天然的；真材实料的；非仿制的；非人工合成的
entry.def: A material or object that is real is natural or functioning, and not artificial or an imitation.

example.ex: ...the smell of real leather...
example.tran: 真皮的气味

example.ex: Who's to know if they're real guns or not?...
example.tran: 谁能知道它们是不是真枪呢？

entry.tran: 真正的；完全的；不掺假的；货真价实的
entry.def: You can use real to describe someone or something that has all the characteristics or qualities that such a person or thing typically has.

example.ex: ...his first real girlfriend...
example.tran: 他第一个真正的女友

example.ex: He's not a real alcoholic...
example.tran: 他并非货真价实的酒鬼。

entry.def: You can use real to describe something that is the true or original thing of its kind, in contrast to one that someone wants you to believe is true.

example.ex: This was the real reason for her call...
example.tran: 这才是她打电话的真正原因。

example.ex: Her real name had been Miriam Pinckus.
example.tran: 她的真名叫米丽娅姆·平卡斯。

entry.def: You can use real to describe something that is the most important or typical part of a thing.

example.ex: When he talks, he only gives glimpses of his real self...
example.tran: 当他讲话时，他只流露少许个人的真实想法。

example.ex: The smart executive has people he can trust doing all the real work.
example.tran: 这个精明的主管所有重要的工作都有信得过的人来做。

entry.def: You can use real when you are talking about a situation or feeling to emphasize that it exists and is important or serious.

example.ex: Global warming is a real problem...
example.tran: 全球变暖是个严重的问题。

example.ex: The prospect of civil war is very real...
example.tran: 发生内战的可能性是真实存在的。

entry.def: You can use real to emphasize a quality that is genuine and sincere.

example.ex: You've been drifting from job to job without any real commitment...
example.tran: 你从一个工作跳到另一个工作，从没有真正投入进去。

example.ex: Germany has shown real determination to come to terms with the anti-Semitism of its past.
example.tran: 德国表现出正视自己反犹主义历史的诚意。

entry.def: You can use real before nouns to emphasize your description of something or someone.

example.ex: 'It's a fabulous deal, a real bargain.'
example.tran: “这桩买卖真让人难以置信，绝对合算。”

example.ex: 'You must think I'm a real idiot.'
example.tran: “你一定觉得我简直是个白痴.”

entry.tran: （成本或价值）实际的，净的，实的
entry.def: The real cost or value of something is its cost or value after other amounts have been added or subtracted and when factors such as the level of inflation have been considered.

example.ex: ...the real cost of borrowing.
example.tran: 借款的实际成本

entry.tran: （用于形容词或副词前表示强调）非常，真正
entry.def: You can use real to emphasize an adjective or adverb.

example.ex: He is finding prison life 'real tough'...
example.tran: 他发现监狱生活“确实难熬”。

example.ex: I don't think you are trying real hard.
example.tran: 我觉得你并没有真正努力尝试。

entry.tran: 真实地;真正地;不是假装
entry.def: If you say that someone does something for real, you mean that they actually do it and do not just pretend to do it.

example.ex: The sex scenes were just good acting. We didn't do it for real.
example.tran: 床戏只是逼真的表演。我们没有来真的。

entry.tran: 来真的，真是这样（表示令人吃惊）
entry.def: If you think that someone or something is very surprising, you can ask if they are for real .

example.ex: Is this guy for real?
example.tran: 这家伙是来真的吗？

entry.tran: 真品；非仿冒品；真实事件
entry.def: If you say that a thing or event is the real thing, you mean that it is the thing or event itself, rather than an imitation or copy.

example.ex: The counterfeits sell for about $20 less than the real thing...
example.tran: 赝品比真货便宜大约20美元。

example.ex: The Blairgowrie Highland Games, on the other hand, are the real thing rather than a media event.
example.tran: 另一方面，布莱尔高里高地赛确实是真正的比赛，而不单是媒体盛事。

means.word_mean: 1. any rational or irrational number
2. an old small silver Spanish coin
1. being or occurring in fact or actuality; having verified existence; not illusory;

sentences.sentence: "Life is real! Life is earnest!"- Longfellow

means.word_mean: 2. no less than what is stated; worthy of the name;

sentences.sentence: "meat and potatoes--I call that a real meal"
"it's time he had a real job"
"it's no penny-ante job--he's making real money"

means.word_mean: 3. being or reflecting the essential or genuine character of something;

sentences.sentence: "a literal solitude like a desert"- G.K.Chesterton

means.word_mean: 4. not synthetic or spurious; of real or natural origin;
5. not to be taken lightly;

sentences.sentence: "statistics demonstrate that poverty and unemployment are very real problems"
"to the man sleeping regularly in doorways homelessness is real"

means.word_mean: 6. possible to be treated as fact;

sentences.sentence: "his brief time as Prime Minister brought few real benefits to the poor"

means.word_mean: 7. being value measured in terms of purchasing power;
8. having substance or capable of being treated as fact; not imaginary;

sentences.sentence: "a mere dream, neither substantial nor practical"

means.word_mean: 9. (of property) fixed or immovable;

sentences.sentence: "real property consists of land and buildings; real estate"

means.word_mean: 10. coinciding with reality;

sentences.sentence: "perceptual error...has a surprising resemblance to veridical perception"- F.A.Olafson

means.word_mean: 11. founded on practical matters;

sentences.sentence: "a recent graduate experiencing the real world for the first time"

means.word_mean: 1. used as intensifiers; `real' is sometimes used informally for `really'; `rattling' is informal;

list.explanation: 货真价实的东西或了不的人，可靠的正派人

example.en: That painting is a copy, but this one is the real McCoy.
example.zh: 那幅油画是摹本，这幅才是真迹。
她是个真正了不起的人。

example.en: You can trust him,he's the real McCoy.
example.zh: 你对他尽可放心，他是正派人。

list.explanation: 纯正的酒(多指威士忌)或麻醉剂(指大麻等毒品)

example.en: If it's not the real McCoy,I don't want it.
example.zh: 如果这不是纯正的威士忌，我不要。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 真的, 真实的, 不动产的
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实→adj.真的, 真实的, 不动产的
realist[n.现实主义者]+ic……的→adj.现实[主义]的
un不+real真实,现实→adj.不真实的, 虚幻的
real真实,现实+ly表副词→adv.真正地, 实在地
real真实,现实+ism主义→realism现实主义
real真实,现实+ist人→n.现实主义者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 真实, 事实, 本体, 逼真
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实+ity表名词→n.真实, 事实, 本体, 逼真

stems_affixes.value_cn: 认识到, 了解, 实现, 实行
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实+ize表动词→v.认识到, 了解, 实现, 实行

Sentence.sentence: But a man named Al Herpin turned out to be a real exception, for supposedly, he never slept!
She made a wise investment in real estate

There is, in our view, no real dispute here, we are all seeking the same thing, which is schools that better serve our children and our nation by encouraging students to tackle tough subjects under the guidance of gifted teachers.
By last year, Wall Street traders, bankers and those who deal in real estate generated 21% of the national income, double their share in the 1950s.
In the real world, problems rarely come neatly packaged, so being able to discern their deep structure is key.
He behaves in a way contrary to his real intention.

means.word_mean: 真的

sentences.en: This is a real pearl, not an imitation.
sentences.cn: 这是真的珍珠, 不是仿制品。

means.word_mean: 真实的; 现实的；实际存在的；非凭空想象的

sentences.en: This is a real experience, not a dream.
sentences.cn: 这是一次真实的经历, 并不是做梦。

jushi.english: That cake was a real treat!
This represents a reduction of 5％ in real terms.
